AM Peak Opposite-Side Boarding On Upper Hudson Line (New Hamburg to Manitou) Starts Tues., July 1

Opposite-side boarding will take place during AM Peak service at New Hamburg, Beacon, Cold Spring, Garrison and Manitou stations starting Tuesday, July 1, until further notice. • Inbound trains departing Poughkeepsie (to Grand Central) from approximately 4 AM-8 AM will arrive on Track 1 at these stations. • Two outbound trains heading to Poughkeepsie—trains #803 and #805—will arrive on Track 2 at these stations. These changes are to accommodate track work in this segment of our territory. At all other times of the day, and on weekends, trains will operate on regular tracks. Customers should listen for station announcements in the event of last-minute track changes.

UPDATE: THROGS NECK BRIDGE - QUEENS BOUND

Update - Planned work: One lane to Queens will remain closed the entire weekend from 10 p.m. on Friday through 5 a.m. Monday. During overnight hours from 10 p.m. to 7 a.m. two of the three Queens-bound lanes will be closed. Two lanes will remain open during weekend daytime hours. Expect delays. During the weekend work at the Throgs Neck Bridge, motorists should also consider using the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge or the Bronx-Whitestone Bridge, which will have three lanes open southbound to Queens.

Break Out Your Bellbottoms & Take Us to Clearwater June 21 & 22!

Take Metro-North’s discount package to the Clearwater Festival this weekend (June 21 & 22). Inspired by Pete Seeger's desire to clean up the river over forty years ago, it’s been called “One of the Top 4 Festivals in the US" by Outside Magazine. Over 100 artists will perform over 7 bio-diesel or solar powered stages including: Lucinda Williams, Norah Jones' new project Puss N Boots, Rufus Wainwright, The Mavericks, Richard Thompson, The Felice Brothers, and more… See http://bit.ly/SeOEZf for full details.

Reminder: MTA Does Not Charge for Lost & Found Inquiries

The MTA warns customers to beware of third-party websites that solicit unofficial lost property reports for a fee. If you have lost an item on a train or at a station, you can submit a lost property claim free of charge and directly to the MTA online, by phone, or in person. Metro-North Issues 100-Day Report on Action Plan

Metro-North has issued its 100-Day Report on the Action Plan established by President Joseph J. Giulietti, which focuses the railroad’s efforts on improving safety, restoring reliability and improving communications. Of 32 initiatives established in the Action Plan, 21 have been fully implemented, seven are in progress and two will be pursued after outside entities submit independent reports. Two more initiatives – implementing a “back to basics” plan for train reliability and service delivery, and communicating service delivery information to customers and elected officials – will remain ongoing, long-term Metro-North priorities. Read the full report at http://bit.ly/SNRbcX . See President Giulietti‘s letter at http://bit.ly/1lcLV96

Alcohol Prohibited on LIRR this Weekend, June 7-8

To maintain orderly travel for those attending the Belmont Stakes and Puerto Rican Day Parade, alcohol will not be allowed on LIRR trains, stations and platforms starting 7 AM Saturday, June 7 through 11:59 PM Sunday, June 8. MTA police will confiscate any alcoholic beverages brought onto the property.

Eighteen trains operate from Penn Station to Belmont Park on Sat. 6/7 beginning 9:45AM for Belmont Stakes. See http://bit.ly/Skyhdr. Customers from LI connect with Stakes trains leaving Jamaica starting 10:06AM. Purchase round-trip rail tkts in advance. Return trains will continue through 10PM for those attending the concert after the last race.

Schedule Adjustments Effective July 7 Improve Connections, Reduce Crowding on New Haven & Harlem Lin

Metro-North will make adjustments to its New Haven and Harlem Line service on Monday, July 7 after closely monitoring performance, taking customer counts and listening to customer suggestions following the implementation of its May 11 schedule change. These changes are intended to improve the customer experience by reducing crowding and enhancing connections. Schedule Adjustments Effective July 7 Improve Connections, Reduce Crowding on New Haven & Harlem Lin

Metro-North will make adjustments to its New Haven and Harlem Line service on Monday, July 7 after closely monitoring performance, taking customer counts and listening to customer suggestions following the implementation of its May 11 schedule change. These changes are intended to improve the customer experience by reducing crowding and enhancing connections. On the Waterbury Branch, one change will occur on Monday, June 9 when the first Waterbury train, the 5:28 AM, will be extended from Bridgeport to Stamford. See details at http://bit.ly/1mfJ14R
